text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

section.section: "Child in State-supervised care" means a child who is in the custody of, committed to, or otherwise placed by a placement agency.
"Child in State-supervised care" does not mean a child at the Charles H. Hickey, Jr. School in Baltimore County who receives an educational program under § 22-308 of this article.

text.section: "Noncollegiate educational institution" has the meaning stated in § 2-206 of this article.
"Notice" means that written, verbal, or other communication regarding the identification of a child in State-supervised care has been effectuated.

"Placement agency" means:
A local department of social services;
The Department of Health and Mental Hygiene;
The Department of Juvenile Services; or
A private agency that:
Engages in the placement of children in homes or with individuals; and
Is licensed by the Social Services Administration under § 5-507 of the Family Law Article.

"Receiving school" means a public school or a noncollegiate educational institution affiliated with a residential child care program or treatment facility that has an educational program approved by the Department in which a child in State-supervised care is newly enrolled or seeks to enroll.

"Sending school" means a public school or a noncollegiate educational institution affiliated with a residential child care program or treatment facility that has an educational program approved by the Department in which a child in State-supervised care was enrolled prior to enrolling, or seeking to enroll, in a receiving school.
